reviewText: I have been looking for years for a Christmas movie I only saw once.  I was so impressed with it, I have never forgotten it.  Finally, I found it on Amazon and was able to purchase it.  I am very happy to finally be able to add it to my collection of Christmas movies.

reviewText: I purchased this for Christmas Is I remember watching it as a young child over and over on a local Christian tv channel and every time it aired I was glued to the tv set. Wholesome family fun at its best !!!
summary: I was so happy to relive my childhood Xmas

reviewText: I bought this DVD for the two stories, "Christmas Is" and "The City That Forgot About Christmas."  I'll be giving the DVD to a childhood friend who watched these two television specials with me when we were kids.  Everything should be fine if the DVD works and the stories are the same.  Feel free to contact me after Christmas for a more accurate review.  Thank you.

reviewText: I was really surprised to see these shows that time had almost forgot.  It was very delightful to see these shows that I had not seen since I was a little girl.  Nettie M.

reviewText: I didn't really know what I was getting when I ordered this, but as it turns out these are obscure (but well-done) old Lutheran shorts from the 1970s. Two are animated, with "The Stableboy's Christmas" a live-action presentation. You might recognize the title character as the kid who played the son in another religious-themed Christmas special, "The Best Christmas Pageant Ever." Each one runs around 25 minutes.These are unashamedly Christian (clearly were made for a Christian audience although I'm not terribly sure when and where they would have aired...if they ever did air at all) and if that bugs you, move along. I found them to be refreshing and while not of the highest quality, just as good as most of the clunky Saturday-morning-style entertainment that came out of that era. They obviously were lovingly-made...somebody put a lot of time and effort into these even though they might not have had the best equipment or talent available.They did actually have some surprisingly big-named vocal talent: June Foray (legendary Looney Tunes voiceover artist), Charles Nelson Reilly and even Casey Kasem!In short, these are fair, not a must-have but interesting particularly if you're looking for a diversion from the watered-down politically-correct nonsense so prevalent in most of the entertainment out there today.
Title: N/A
